page.title: 16Gnosall Fire Station
page.content: Gnosall has a retained fire service, which means that it is part time. The firemen must live within one mile of the fire station. When there is a call, bells ring in the station and a tape plays to tell the men where to go. The firemen carry a pocket alerter which bleeps when there is a call. When the alert sounds the men have 3 minutes to get to the station. They should be dressed and ready to turn out in four minutes. In a year there are about 150 calls on average. There are always 4 firemen available. The most commom calls in winter are to chimney fires. Firemen also go to farm fires, house fires and road traffic accidents. Firemen practice fire drills twice a week. The most unusual calls have been to rescue a parrot and to get bees out of a chimney.
